did.physloc: Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology 5 MetroTech Center Brooklyn, NY, 11201 (646) 997-3943 polyarchives@nyu.edu

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jonathan Soffer is a professor at NYU Tandon School of Engineering in the Technology, Culture, and Society Department. His work is primarily on Ed Koch and Matthew Ridgway.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jonathan Soffer Papers contain research documents from 1989 to 2007. These documents were assembled by Soffer during his time researching for books on Ed Koch and Matthew Ridgway. The documents are primarily archival and scholarly research regarding New York politics. Papers contain interview, newspaper clippings, academic article, drafts, and archival research. The collection is 10 linear feet, located on bay 26, shelves 4E, 5E, 6E, 7E, and 7F.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is housed in 10 boxes and arranged into two series and eight sub-series per series. Series: Koch Project, Sub-series: Archival Manuscript Research, Correspondence, Drafts, Interviews, Newspaper Research, Research, Scholarly Articles, and Teaching. This collection was not arranged by the archivists; Jonathan Soffer's original order was kept and only light arranging was done for clarity. His file names were preserved. "Illegible" is noted where words in file names could not be transcribed.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated to the Polytechnic Institute of New York University Archives by Jonathan Soffer in 2021.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Polytechnic University in all its forms are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Poly Archives. Please contact the Poly Archives, polyarchives@nyu.edu, 646-997-3530.
